byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and Wai Moe from Yangon, Myanmar. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and WAI MOE

abstract: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi chooses Beijing for her first official visit to foreign capital since assuming leadership of Myanmar; signals intention to establish China-friendly foreign policy, which risks unsettling relations with United States.
lead_paragraph: With her first visit to a major capital since becoming leader of Myanmar, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi signaled that her foreign policy would be more friendly toward China.
snippet: With her first visit to a major capital since becoming leader of Myanmar, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi signaled that her foreign policy would be more friendly toward China....

headline.main: Visiting Beijing, Myanmar’s Aung San Suu Kyi Seeks to Mend Relations
headline.print_headline: Myanmar’s Leader Visits Beijing, Signaling a Move to Mend Relations
